message.content:
{"id": "124620", "title": "Bug 124620 - Referenced Parameter icon should be invalid if the parameter in library is deleted", "description": "", "OB": "The referenced parameter icon should be marked as invalid when the source parameter in the library is deleted.", "EB": "Currently, when the source parameter in the library is deleted, the referenced parameter icon remains unchanged in the report, giving the impression that nothing has happened.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue:\
1. Create a library with at least one parameter.\
2. Create a report and use the above library.\
3. In the library explorer, pull the parameter to the data explorer view of the report.\
4. Open the library file and delete the parameter.\
5. Reopen the report design file and observe that the icon of the referenced parameter remains unchanged, even though the source parameter has been deleted."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:

It is acceptable.Expected Result:The icon of referenced parameter should be invalid. ', 'SR': 'Insert a report scalar parameter.2.Create a report, use the above library. Then reopen the report design file, the icon of parameter seems nothing happened. '}
